meanings.definition: The body of stories and myths associated with a particular culture or historical figure.
meanings.sent1: The legendry of King Arthur includes tales of knights and magical quests.
meanings.sent2: The legendry of Hercules is known for his incredible strength and heroic deeds.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the legendry of dragons and wizards in the storybook.
meanings.sent4: The legendry of Robin Hood stealing from the rich to give to the poor inspired many.
meanings.sent5: The legendry of ancient gods and goddesses painted a vivid picture of mythical worlds.

meanings.definition: The quality of being legendary or famous.
meanings.sent1: Her talent and hard work earned her a reputation for legendry in the music industry.
meanings.sent2: The actor's legendry status grew as he starred in blockbuster after blockbuster.
meanings.sent3: The legendry of the mysterious singer added an air of intrigue to the music scene.
meanings.sent4: The legendry of the legendary explorer's adventures captured the imagination of many.
meanings.sent5: The legendry of the legendary athlete's achievements inspired a new generation of sports enthusiasts.
